12039Journal of Chemical Sciences[Formerly: Proceedings (Chemical Sciences)]J Chem Sci0974-36260973-7103Springer-VerlagIndias12039-009-0049-04910.1007/s12039-009-0049-0ArticleSheet-like of MoV-SmIII assembly containing [MoV(CN)8]3− and Sm3+ ions as building blocksMaShu-Lin1aRenShi1MaYue2LiaoDai-Zheng2dgrid.464478.d0000000097290286Department of Application Chemistry, College of ScienceTianjin University of Commerce300134TianjinPR Chinagrid.216938.70000000098787032Department of ChemistryNankai University300071TianjinPR Chinamashulin@tjcu.edu.cnliaodz@nankai.edu.cn2782009720091214421427258200972200924200913520092782009© Indian Academy of Sciences 20092009Abstract

The reaction of [Mo(CN)8]3− with Sm3+ and 2,2′-bipyridine (bpy) lead to a sheet-like bimetallic complex, {Sm(H2O)9[Sm2(bpy)2(OH)2·75(NO3)0·25][Mo(CN)8]2}n (1) in EtOH/H2O mixture solvent. The complex 1 crystallizes in monoclinic, space group C2/c. The structural investigation denotes that the layers interaction with each other by π-π stacks and hydrogen bonds result in a 3D network, containing Sm(H2O)93+ as guest molecules in the holes. The magnetic behaviour of the complex 1 has been studied.

elements.content: The reaction of [Mo(CN)8]3− with Sm3+ and 2,2′-bipyridine (bpy) lead to a sheet-like bimetallic complex, {Sm(H2O)9[Sm2(bpy)2(OH)2·75(NO3)0·25][Mo(CN)8]2}n (1) in EtOH/H2O mixture solvent. The complex 1 crystallizes in monoclinic, space group C2/c. The structural investigation denotes that the layers interaction with each other by π-π stacks and hydrogen bonds result in a 3D network, containing Sm(H2O)93+ as guest molecules in the holes. The magnetic behaviour of the complex 1 has been studied.
elements.clean_text:
Abstract

The reaction of [Mo(CN)8]3- with Sm3+ and 2,2'-bipyridine (bpy) lead to a sheet-like bimetallic complex, {Sm(H2O)9[Sm2(bpy)2(OH)2⋅75(NO3)0⋅25][Mo(CN)8]2}n (1) in EtOH/H2O mixture solvent. The complex 1 crystallizes in monoclinic, space group C2/c. The structural investigation denotes that the layers interaction with each other by π-π stacks and hydrogen bonds result in a 3D network, containing Sm(H2O)93+ as guest molecules in the holes. The magnetic behaviour of the complex 1 has been studied.
